alert.note: Alert for Atascosa; Bexar; Comal; Medina (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 22 at 9:28AM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues until noon today * WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following counties, Atascosa, Bexar, Comal and Medina. * WHEN...Until noon CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 919 AM CST, The rain has stopped across Atascosa, Bexar and Medina County. However, there are multiple street closures across these counties with water slowly coming down. Therefore, the Flood Advisory is now in effect through noon today to allow the water levels to continue to come down. - Some locations that are likely experiencing street flooding include... San Antonio, New Braunfels, Schertz, Live Oak, Selma, Devine, Castroville, San Antonio Int Airport, Canyon Lake Dam, Canyon Lake, Leon Valley, Helotes, Fair Oaks Ranch, Alamo Heights, Windcrest, Terrell Hills, Bulverde, Garden Ridge, Shavano Park and Hollywood Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
